review: Was their for a free food test / training opening and it was great. Would have like to get a beer with the burger but could not because it was not officially open but their root beer and orange cream soda was tasty.   It was our servers first day and he could not have done a better job. The food was prepared perfect and my wife is on a Gluten-Free Diet and their Gluten-Free hamburger roll is great.  The only problem I can see is this place will be packed and will have to go on off times. Great job guys wish you well.

Went here during their soft opening training period, and really enjoyed myself. We were seated at the bar, and the bartender Anthony was amazing. He kept us laughing and entertained throughout the whole meal, plus provided great service on checking up on us to make sure everything was okay. (Which it was, food was delicious!) Because of him, I will come back once y'all are officially open!

We had the pleasure of getting to test out the newest location in Champions Gate during their preview/training. We had the pleasure of meeting Vanessa and Michael who I believe are management, both made a great first impression. We were seated and had Diaz has a server, who hands down had to be one of the best servers we've encountered at a chain restaurant. Our preview included an entree and a app for the table. We selected the Buzz Boneless wings, a Mad Love Finest burger, a Chili Chili Burger and kids' Mac and Cheese and Pizza. Our daughter didn't care for the pizza, nothing wrong she's just a bit picky, Michael was quick to replace it was a grilled cheese for us and checked back to make sure it was perfect. The food all arrived fresh, hot and exactly as ordered. Diaz was on the ball, he replaced drinks as needed, checked on us often and was very personable. If the service was this epic during a training preview, we will be back often.

Went today for the soft opening and it's my birthday the staff was really nice even sang HBD to me  Can't wait to go back when they are officially open. I don't eat red meat a lot and I'm not a fan of onions but I had a burger that had Canadian bacon and onions on it so Amazing. My sons loved it too...

We visited during their training period and it was a great experience.  Even though it was "training", everyone really seemed to know what they were doing, and things ran smoothly.  Food came out quickly, everything was just as ordered and very tasty.  Our server Monica was fantastic-we have a 4 and a 5yr old and she actually asked them for their order and spoke to them, rather than asking us.  I really appreciate that-I don't expect everyone to love kids, but since they are paying guests, its nice for them to be acknowledged.  The restaurant was beautiful and we look forward to coming back again and again!!

Grand opening at Championsgate!!!!! Yeah!!!! We have been expecting this for several months and finally here!! As usual, not disappointed, but ecstatically satisfied!!! We loved our server Larry and his energy!!! So thrilled to have my favorite gourmet burger located close to home!!! We will be back again, and again, and again.....

Went for the testing... PHOEBE IS THE BEST! Food was great! Location could be hard to find for people who are just driving around looking for a place to eat. We will definitely be regulars at this location!

Simply wonderful!!!  Enough help that you were well taken care of and food that was fresh and hot.  Fast, friendly staff!  Great experience all the way around!!!  Hats off and welcome to the neighborhood!!!

Don't know why everyone is talking about this place? Over priced burgers and the fries where warm and soggy. Bottomless fries? They arrive after your meal is finished.  I can go to five guys burgers and get a better burger and fries and pay a lot less. I'm in no rush to return...
Just burger no taste at all just as plain as can be and $10.00 for a bacon cheeseburger that tastes like cardboard.....no thanks

Heard great things about here but I wasn't too impressed.  It wasn't nasty but it didn't wow me like I expected. I got the prime chop house, the toppings were really good but the burgers it self is very flavorless. I didn't even taste salt. The garlic parm fries were flavorless and greasy.  Not sure if I'd return. One thing I can say is the staff is very friendly and professional.

Worst service ever. Our dishes were dirty when we ordered our food and my lettuce had a lot of brown pieces in it. We didn't even know who our waiter was until thirty minutes after we sat down. Also no one took our drink order for fifteen minutes and we got our appetizer before we got our drinks or silverware. We specifically asked for no herbs on top of the Mac and cheese we ordered for our son. When we got our food there was green herbs all over it. They said they'd make it again but by the time he finally got his food made the right way, we'd already eaten and he was starving. Not a happy mama! We've never eaten at Red Robin before and we never will again!

My boyfriend and I came here last night and I'm happy to say that, we had a much better experience than the last time we visited a different location, out of state. For being a new place, everything went smoothly. Our burgers were delicious and the woman who waited on us was great! She recommended the garlic fries and I'm glad that she did! Can't wait to come back in the future!

This service is great, the food is just ok. I don't think the burgers are that great, good but nothing more. The place is nice and the possibility of a great time is there, maybe next time...as far as endless fries goes, I would rather have better quality fries, like the one at the Ovation Bistro Bar,  just down the street.

Horrible place. Management is a joke, avoid this place at all costs. The Red Robin in Winter Garden is much better this place is run and much more friendly. They have some teenage manager Shawntay that is on some power trip and trying to show off he has some power. I haven't even had the food yet and I am already ready to leave.

I have visited this location twice and will never go back. We wait a unreasonable amount of time for our food to come, when it comes it is wrong and when we ask to have it fixed, they scrape off what you don't want on it, slap a new bun on there and give it right back to you. The kitchen doesn't know what is on the menu and how to make it, I ordered the tavern burger with mac and cheese and no spicy ranch and it came out missing the entire mac and cheese portion! The manager tried to tell me that the spicy ranch is in the mac and cheese but I ordered the same thing on my first visit and it came out fine. The manager Deshante Dickens was less than friendly and became argumentative with us, after trying to argue with us about the orders he said "what do you want to make it ok". They have been open for about a month now and should have it somewhat together by now, but every time I come here it's worse.

Oh what a disappointing addition to an area that so desperately needs good dining options. We've lived in the area for many years and were actually here when the exit off of I4 did not exist.  The area continues to expand and attract new businesses.  But Red Robin should have thought this through first.  Our advice is to skip this one and head north on 429 to the Villages location.  That site is better laid out, friendlier staff, more seating, etc.   We've at twice at the Champions Gate location with problems each time... wrong food, poor service, delayed service, bad food, etc.  Both times the manager on duty had to come to the table.
Decided to eat here last night. I got the black and Bleu and it was amazing. The staff was good. We called in our order. No complaints at all.

Food was very good but service was not. Server never came back to check how my food was. Got pretzel appetizer and ran out of cheese dip after 4 pretzels. Still had 10 more pretzels but no dip. Server delivered my burger which was great but did not ask if I needed anything else. Dropped food and ran off. Three bites into my burger my drink was empty. Put glass at edge of table hoping my server who walked by three times would see it but never got my refill. Never saw a Mgr who usually stop by to check on service and meal. Bottom line you can have great food but service will destroy your meal and the 20 plus dollars I spent on a one person meal.  By the way I saw the Mgr as I was leaving. Was eating in the bar area not worrying about her customers.

Been wanting to try a Red Robin for a long time. Unfortunately, the experience was underwhelming and so was the food. Our waiter was excellent, but the great service and unlimited drinks and sides did not make up for the overcooked burgers, hair in my salad and dirty restrooms.

Horrible customer service. Food cold. Waiter didn't ask us if we wanted refills or more fries. When I asked for more fries they took more than 20 minutes and came cold and looked like someone's leftovers. Burger cold, bun soggy and they put cheese when I said no cheese. Soda taste like seltzer water. I asked for another flavor and that one taste like dirty water. So upset. Went to the one in international drive and that one was awesome. Recommended it to my mom and the experience was so bad. Never again.  Next time I will drive further to International drive.
Love the bottomless fries and drinks. They have a great variety of burgers. The service has been good every time we come in. If you enjoy a shake with your burger, theirs are fantastic.

I was pleasantly surprised with the changes brought in by the brand overhaul at RR. A nice variety of meals in the menu. Gourmet burgers can be pricey but quality can make up for that at times. Service was very good and the bottomless fries are ok if you can\want to eat more than one serving. Good stuff RR!

This restaurant truly is a hit or miss. The staff is incredibly nice but the cooking Is subpar at best. When we went in the first time we ordered food in the restaurant and food took quite a long time.  When it did finally come out my burger was in a very soggy bun. Today I ordered food to go. Once again staff was very nice but food took approximately 15 minutes longer than I was told for my to go order. While the fries were hot, once again the food was severely lacking. The fries were not seasoned at all!! The tuscan mac n cheese was $7 and it was in a small container that was barely filled and overcooked!!  The onion rings were cold and soggy. The only thing made right was my husband's bleu cheese burger. If it was not for Kevin's service tonight this would be a one star review. Spent $45 to include tip for a meal that is so far below standards it is not funny. Could have got worse service, better food at half the cost at McDonalds and been more satisfied. Lesson learned.
Not impressed with the food, service was great, good employee customer service but the food was awful.  Ordered onion rings and they tasted like old oil , ordered sweet potatoes and the same ;(
Made me horrifically sick. I asked for no pink, and was given a burger that had uncooked meat in the center. This is the worst Red Robin I've been to!!

We visited Red Robin finally! I am not a huge burger person but ....every once in a while i sooo want one. I feel like the girl in Josie and the Pussycats who just yells out "I want a Big Mac!"  yet I am too much Of a foodie to actually allow McDonald's to pass my lips except in cases of extreme hunger or under the looming spectre of low blood sugar,but I digress... We visited after a movie on a Friday nite. We were told that the wait would be 30 min but it was only 15 or so.  They ask for your phone # so that they can text you when your table is ready ..I really like that. They do not have wifi...I do not like that....at all...This is 2016 ,Red Robin...get some wireless.... Yuuuum! Rant ...end. I had a Mushroom and Swiss burger, Hubs had the Black and Bleu burger.  Both were cooked well an quite juicy the mushrooms on mine were cooked in a garlicky sauce that made them even more delicious. The bun was soft and fresh.  This restaurant has endless sides.....if you order a salad with your burger (who does that?)(my husband and supermodels apparently) you can have and unlimited amount....they just keep it comin'..if you order fries, that too is without end, fortunately I was not super hungry (I was still full of movie  snacks) I. was able to exercise restraint and did not make them stand and deliver on the "bottomless fries" promise.  They also have fancy dipping sauces for fries but was not brave enough to try one since I love catsup.  I truly enjoyed my burger here and this will be my new go to spot for them.  The atmosphere was bright and busy...if you don't want to feel as though you are in a school cafeteria at lunchtime opt to sit in the bar area. Families with (lots of) kids seem to fill the table area and it makes for a loud evening.  I will def go back the next time I feel the need to satisfy my apparent,periodic need for ground beef and mushrooms.  The service was pretty good for a busy Friday nite our waitress was attentive but not stalky so it was a good experience.

Despite first impressions this place has improved significantly. I've been here a number of occasions since my first review and I now have a favorite burger and dessert. The black and bleu burger is stacked with blue cheese crumbles and sauce, portobello mushrooms and sautéed onions on a ciabatta bread bun. It's packed so high with ingredients I have to finish the other half at home later. For dessert the chocolate fruffles are to die for! Super rich brownie strips covered in chocolate and sea salt with raspberry dipping sauce. It's the perfect item to share. The service has improved the most. Everyone I've encountered has been pleasant, kind, and helpful with suggestions and that extends to the servers and bar staff alike. On one occasion my coworkers and I called and found out they were finally taking phone orders. We had a great chat with the woman on the phone and when I came to pick up the food it turns out the woman had actually been the manager. She ended up packing our to-go bag with magnets and Red Robin burger spices just to be nice! I highly recommend this location!

My sis picked me up to go to Red Robin at 11 pm because I was having a rough day. It was great that she was there to bring a little bit of sunshine to my gloomy little day with a guilty pleasure....burgers! We had the full stacked onion rings and they were outstanding. Golden, crisp, and delicious. They didn't taste grease filled and there wasn't any real residue of oil on my finger tips. I had the Bonzai Burger. It was perfectly cooked. It had lots of flavor. None of the ingredients over-powered the taste of the actual meat. Really well balanced. Our waitress, I believe her name was Nancy was really sweet and attentive. She constantly made an effort to make sure we were enjoying our meal. I also noticed she took care of her customers at other tables with the same sense of urgency. She was an older woman and had the energy of a young 20 year old. In the end I had a good meal, great service that lightened up my day that evening.

I love Red Robin, always great customer service! This is a new spot over in Davenport right off I4, Champions gate. I was so happy when they built this place. It gets VERY pack so if you go make sure you go half hour or even and hour before the lunch and dinner mess. Over all the food is great, I will be going again.
best burgers around my way, the service is top notch and that's my place to go when I want some serious quality burgers, my family loves it too.

This is the best Red Robin I've been to. I've been here twice and have had 5 star experiences both times. Our server was attentive and chatty. He put on the Thursday night NFL game on the Tv right in front of me and I thought that little step extra was amazing. I ordered the ghost pepper burger and loved it. It's got some very intense heat as the cheese and sauce have ghost peppers in them. It's topped with fried jalapeño peppers to add a hint more of heat. Our server was on point when it came to delivering on their bottomless fries. We just about finished the first round when he brought us another basket. This is also the first place to ever cook my burger right. My wife and I love the chocolate truffle fries for dessert, but our server almost sold us on the donut tower. If we weren't hooked on the truffle fries, we would have tried it. The location is right off of I-4 in champions gate. Great for an in and out!

Walk in. Told 10 minute wait when there are obvious empty tables on both sides of the room. Waited for 5. Placed drink and food orders. Drinks returned promptly but food took 45 minutes. We were later told that management was having a meeting with the kitchen and that's why the food was delayed. A meeting at the start of the dinner rush? Food was unexceptional; 4 out of the 6 plates had something wrong. One was comp'ed and removed from bill. Server did her part and was good but it was the kitchen (and management) that turned this into a negative experience.
One of the best burger joints in Kissimmee! Don't miss it Tuesday's buy one get one free, burgers, I'm just  saying!!
Gourmet burgers? I think not. We're visiting from LA and I can't believe I gave this place a try. Very dirty restaurant and servers are rude and look scruffy. I would not go back.

I was here with my friend back in Fall 2016 for the first time at this Red Robin location. We live in the area, so this is very convenient. I was familiar with the business, so I knew what to expect from the business.  For those of you who do not know about the business, this business is famous for their burgers. They create strange tasteful burger options from a small bite to a large meal of various flavors in every bite. Have a burger with a egg on top; BBQ burger with onion straws, BBQ sauce, and Bacon. Or my favorite: Chili Burger that comes with actual Chili on top of the burger. Very messy, but taste amazing!! If you do not like burgers, they offer chicken, salads, and other similar dishes. The best part (and most unhealthy part) is the Bottomless fries. Think about eating as many you want of very tasting Steak Fries. Very dangerous in my opinion.  The Pretzel bites Appetizer with the Beer Cheese is amazing. I highly recommend getting those to share or have them for yourself. The Beer Cheese sauce taste great and I like to use it for my fries.  You can order seasons to your fries for an additional small charge and order dipping sauce for free. The food menu offers creative dishes to enjoy, so why not have a delicious drink menu. Well they do. From endless Root Beer Floats to a Blue Moon Milk Shake. You read that right, a Blue Moon Milk Shake!!! They actual use Blue Moon beer in the milk shake. It taste amazing as well. If you love Blue Moon and milk shakes, then you will be Heaven with this tasty treat.  I actually got a small buzz from the drink. Sadly, these are not unlimited. They have other adventurous drinks that are non-alcohol. I love this place all around from the food to the fun decor inside. Friendly staff members, efficient service, clean tables, wonderful tasty dishes, and just a great place to dine with friends or family, this business has it all.  I hope you enjoy a great a burger with a Blue Moon Milkshake. Now I want a Blue Moon Milkshake.
Absolutely fabulous!! Our waitress, Michelle, was attentive and super nice. She recommended the Banzai burger and the southern charm burger. Both were delicious!! Will definitely be back.

Good food great service. RR is usually delicious. Unfortunately I can't eat there often due to the high-calorie menu. Yes they have a lower calorie options but that's no fun! This location is really nice.

This burger place is tasty for the meal but the service and wait time leave something to be desired. We started with drinks which was prompt and it was a nice start to which I thought was going to be a nice meal. We started with the queso dip which came out fairly quickly. It was delicious with a nice kick. We got two milkshakes an Oreo and chocolate. The Oreo tasted like burnt plastic. The chocolate was fine. The Oreo was replaced with a mint shake. This was better. The meals were mac and cheese burger, tavern burger, kids birger, and mac and cheese with salad. The wait time was ridiculous. Over 40 min for these meals. The burgers were tasty though. The mac and cheese very very bland. The worst was service. Our app and plates never cleared, refills slow couldn't get a straw, endless fries came after meal was done. No sorry. Manager walked by with no acknowledgement to dishes piled on tables. Won't come back with the many options in the area.
Orlando Champions Gate location.  Service was excellent but I have visited other locations and food was better.

So far this place sucks. They are way under on their time to wait and we have now waited about 45 minutes for our food.  Asked for some fries because my kids are starving and they never came. Food was greasy and after we were eating we were asked if we wanted the fries.  Pay machine not working. Horrible experience.

The burgers (3 of them) were awful.  overcooked,  undercooked, and ok.  Buns were hard and soggy like they were microwaved.    Fries were cold first time and hot on immediate refill ....we complained to get hot fries when they arrived,  but had not yet bitten the burgers.     Second set of burgers were handled by the manager.  Much better.  over all : overpriced for thicker then MD's burgers.  ya, nice to have different toppings BUT nothing can really cover bad burgers.   The strawberry lemonade was wonderful.

Let me say the food is great; but the service in which me an my family received was horrible. We ran out of napkins had to go to the bathroom to get napkins, buttonless steak fries sounds nice when you get them unlike us we asked didn't come out till we where leaving, I love their campfire sauce so does my wife but when asked never got it. Like I said the food was great but service was horrendous and it being for my wife's birthday left us feeling more of a bother to them. Now this isn't the first time this has happened to us. We went to the one over in Barndon same thing happened. I love their burgers an food and drinks but if the service doesn't get better we will not go to another one again.

Outstanding food and service both times I've been here.  The server we had yesterday was especially wonderful.  Immediately upon greeting our table, she noticed that the sun was shining brightly at us through our table's window.  She commented on this and lowered the blinds right away.  Their "Royalty Club" Easter promotion got us in the door yesterday, and she carefully explained what was included as well as the order requirements.  She also made sure the item came off of the check at the end of the meal.   The timing of the service was a little on the slow side, but all the food that came to the table was well worth waiting for.  Both of our burgers were cooked and prepared exactly as we ordered, and the fries were magically delicious.  Throughout the meal, our server stopped by a couple of times to ask if we wanted to order more fries...this never once happened at the I-Drive location.   We don't normally order desserts at restaurants, but the menu had a photo of a doughnut tower which we didn't want to pass up.  It was awesome!!  Great food and service from beginning to end, we will most definitely be back again and again.

GREAT experience!! Everyone was very attentive to our needs, food came out quick and was delicious! Better than most Red Robin's we have visited. When we are in the area again we will definitely come here to eat again.

My family really enjoys Red Robin and my daughter worked at a Red Robin while in college, so I hesitated to leave a bad review but the service was so horrible, it seems unfair to subject other unsuspecting guests to it.  I met my family here from work before my son-in-law, daughter and new grand-baby flew back to Indiana.  We ordered and waited, and waited, and waited.  A total of 40 minutes.  I told the waiter to cancel my order because I had to go back to work and could not wait any longer.  He said the order was already being prepared. I told him I had been waiting 40 minutes and the rest of my lovely family was going to stay and eat but I unfortunately couldn't stay and enjoy a last lunch with them because the service was so slow.  They brought the food out after I left and brought my burger. My family said I had to leave and they needed to take it off the bill.  The manager came out and said "it's just going to go to waste"   My daughter told him that really wasn't our problem, if it had been brought out in a timely fashion I could've stayed and eaten it, and to take it off the bill. He said "okay, okay, I'll take it off" but when the bill came, the burger was still on it.  My youngest daughter pointed this out to the waiter who said the manager was on the phone. 15 minutes later, he finally came out.  My daughter who works for Disney pointed out how poor his customer service and attitude were and again, he said "okay, okay, I'll take it off.  I have never written a bad review, but we will never eat here again. The customer service, wait time, and management were beyond poor!

First time I've been to a Red Robin. They have a great concept with their gourmet style burgers, bottomless fries, and bottomless specialty drinks (was intrigued by their root beer float and flavored cream sodas, but ended up going with the prickly pear flavored purple lemonade). I haven't had prickly pear flavored anything since the last time I was in Arizona, so I was psyched to see this was an option with their flavored lemonades and it did not disappoint. It was a good balance between sweet and sour. I ate the ghost burger with garlic fries. I thought the burger was very good, the right amount of heat for someone who has a fairly high tolerance for spicy foods but doesn't want to be downing several glasses of water throughout the meal. I about liked that none of the food was overly greasy, which is a huge plus. The garlic fries were an interesting fry option and the fresh parsley was a nice touch. Service was also very good, very prompt and attentive. We arrived at the back end of a lunch rush so the food took longer than average to arrive, but the waitress brought out some fries for us to snack on while we waited, which was much appreciated!

First I have to say that the restaurant was incredibly cold that could not enjoy ourselves. My wife and I were seated at a table that must have all of their vents pointing at the table. Will, our server, was pleasant and the only reason I did not review this restaurant as 1 star. Will gave us some recommendations and I wish we would have gotten the recommendations. I eventually had to ask to move to a different table that was a little bit warmer but not much. The food took a long time to arrive. There was a party of 8 that was seated way after us and left way before us. My wife ordered a shrimp and cod entree. She said the cod was awful and did not eat it. I had a burger with Mac and cheese on it. When it arrived, I had to ask Will where the mac and cheese was. He told me it was between the lettuce and bun. The portions were so small that I wondered why the plates were so small. After eating the food, I am glad the portions were small. I found the smallest amount on the burger. But it was not the lack of Mac that made the burger bad. There was some kind of sauce on it that made it spicy and I found horrible. Since we left, two hours ago, I have felt awful from what I ate. I have never felt this bad from something I ate. The coldness of the restaurant and awful food will make me not return. I normally give a restaurant 2 visits before I decide against it but I cannot justify returning.

The best thing about Red Robin is their steak fries. This Red Robin was packed but we still only waited about 5 minutes to be seated. The service was good. They also have a pretty good kids menu. I had the pub mac and cheese which was okay tasting. My husband really enjoyed his burger. My sister in law had a salad and substituted the shrimp which she said tasted like frozen shrimp. I do like that they have the option to pay via the tablet at the table as it makes leaving way easier.

After a day at the parks, my family was looking forward to dinner. We decided to try the new Champions Gate location. Upon arriving, the place appeared nice. We went to the men's room which was totally unacceptable. Trash overflowing water all over floors so you slipped. The main floors were covered with salt to prevent sliding as well. We sat, our waitress was in the weeds. She forgot our drink order and after waiting over 35 minutes our food finally arrived.  3 of the 4 orders were wrong. Not sure what the kitchen was thinking.  The manager appeared to be putting out "several fires" at tables due to errors (I was able to hear some of the conversations). Hopefully this location is an isolated one. Corporate needs to focus on retraining or supervision. Probably will never return. Not impressed. Food was average, service poor. Cleanliness below par.

I have seen the commercials and I wanted to see if they really had the yummm... Well I was pleasantly surprised. We order the short onion ring appetizer, whiskey river BBQ burger, and the burning love burger. With endless fries of course! Both burgers were very tasty and large! The onion rings were really good, and the endless fries were also good... but by the time we finished our burgers there was no room for the endless fries! I had to tap out after the original plate of fries.  The sweet tooth hit me and I ordered a Oreo shake to go! It was very good and I love the old fashioned hand spun shakes.  Service was great, they were very helpful for us first timers at Red Robin... I wish we had some in Arkansas because I would definitely be going back!

This is the only Red Robbin location I have ever been to but if they are all like the Champions Gate location I would highly recommend. For a bugler place they had a good sized menu. Everything we ordered was excellent and our server was one of the best I have ever had.

So disappointed! My poor son in law ordered over $50 worth of food for pick up & when he got home, part of the order was missing. He had to drive back & there was no compensation for his inconvenience. The food was cold & they couldn't enjoy their meal as a family. They just moved here this week & have been unpacking & dealing w 3 young children. Needless to say, they won't be returning. Love, The MIL

This was the best Red Robin experience I have ever had. Very delicious food and excellent service. We enjoyed: - shroom burger - smokey jack - kids cheese pizza (thick crust) - fries, fries, more bottomless fries - side salad - chocolate shake I sat in the bar area, ate, and then got the rest to take back to the family that refused to escape the sun at the pool to go eat. Servers timed everything perfectly so that when I got back to the hotel the milk shakes were still mostly shake and food was still hot.  I highly recommend this location for guests at the Omni
First time visiting Red Robin! I was very pleased with service and food. They have a great special for 6.99 for a burger and endless fries which is pretty delicious and cheap.
Awful service. Was sat down and completely ignored by three different servers. Asked  to speak to the manager, and he had no explanation for the poor service. Ended up getting up and leaving.

First time at a Red Robin and was pretty excited to try their food. Place was mildly busy, but took a server 10 minutes to even greet us at the front, then was told our party of 2 would have to wait 20 minutes for a table unless we wanted high top tables...we went for the high top as we were very hungry. A table of servers were eating behind us on their break and were loudly gossiping/arguing about work and other things which made us quite uncomfortable. We ordered our food and waited a good 15 minutes for it which wasn't too unreasonable but when it arrived my order was wrong and my boyfriend had maybe 10 fries on his plate. They apologized and redid my order. I waited another good 15 minutes, meanwhile my boyfriend practically finished his food. When they returned with my "fixed" order it was a redo of my boyfriend's order and not mine. They never refilled our drinks or gave us more bottomless fries and I finally said I didn't want to wait anymore so we paid for my boyfriend's order and just left. Was really disappointed as I was looking forward to eating here.

The restaurant was clean, although the bathrooms did need some tidying up, IMO. The place was busy when we got there, but we were seated pretty quickly, regardless. Our waitress. Well... she was very sweet, and did her best, but even with that, the order was wrong from the beginning. I asked for no tomatoes, burger came out with extra tomatoes. She even saw me picking them off and said nothing. We also asked for garlic fries, but all we received were regular.  Had to ask another server for garlic. Regular fries were cold, and lacked flavor, I might add. And then it was slow service when the food arrived. Very interesting to note: I wouldn't see her for a really long time, and the lmao suddenly, she would reappear right next to me. It just had an odd vibe to it, ya know? At the end, we asked for a box for our garlic fries. Now any other RR location, they will bring another got order to go, but not this one. I didn't want to wait any longer, as we had plans afterwards, but my goodness, it just was odd.  A manager was out on the floor, greeting guests, and helping with orders. Even though I was not really happy, and it was my birthday to boot, I didn't say anything. Who knows? It could been the waitress's first day for all I know! But I would be willing to return to this location, because even with the mishaps, it still beats the International Drive location, hands-down.
Love me some Red Robin. This is a smaller RR than I'm used to, but the service is good and the food is always what I expected.

This was the worst RR I've ever been to.  Some of the appetizer plates were dirty, we managed to just use the clean ones.  Then when my kids meal's came out their plates had dried on spaghetti sauce. We spoke to a manager who said that one of the cooks probably just touched the plates but offered a discount or dessert.  The waitress was clueless as to what was going on, once she figured it out she was mainly concerned w saving her tip.

This was our second time at this location, second time sitting in the bar high-tops, and second time receiving bad service. We felt over looked and neglected. Lesson learned, wait to be seated in the dining section.

The food is good. If you want creative burgers and unlimited sides, this is the place. Pretty cheap. However the two times I have went the Servers were very slow. First, I felt that they were understaffed but my Server took frequent smoke breaks and was seated too quickly. Then the second experience, we just felt that the server was soo inexperience. I had to ask the Bussers to assistance. Never once I observed an available Manager to address this. Probably would go back for orders on the go. But to actually dine, both separate occasions, we just could not understand why the Servers were so forgetful and slow.

This was the worst, most unorganized RR I've ever been to. My family and I ordered RR over the phone for pick up. We ordered a number of things, but upon ordering, they told us they were out of boneless wings, so we settled for bone-in wings. As we drove to pick up our order, on time, we received a missed call. Upon entering, our waitress informed us that they were also out of tortilla strips for our salad, and that had been the reason for the missed call. Again, we settled. Finally, as we waited for our chicken tortilla soup order, our waitress once AGAIN informed us they were out of the soup. They did not ask if they could comp. our soup and gave us a salty version of French onion soup instead. We were given no compensation for all the missing parts, and very little sympathy for our troubles.

This place is super busy. I ordered the new veggie burger and they confused my order with meat (ironic I know), so I had to wait again for my correct burger. They were nice about it and even took it off my check which I wasn't expecting but it was still bothersome to have to wait. The server brought out extra fries while I waited which was nice since I was starving.  The new veggie burger is delicious. It really has everything you need with avocados, mushrooms and swiss cheese my favorite.  My husband also ordered the tavern taco burger and he ordered it with meat for a little pink and they made it to perfection. Typically when he says some pink the burgers at other Red Robins locations they have no pink and are just well done.

I had a Southwest Sambrero Salad. I added the Salmon to it and wow! It was amazing!! The food was fresh, the salmon was cooked perfectly. I would recommend the food to anyone! I sat at the bar on 10/11/17, the gentleman bartending was excellent. He was very friendly and good sense of humor, my refills were on point and made sure everything was perfect. I would recommend this place to anyone!  Thanks Red Robin!

We have visited this particular Red Robin many times since they opened. It's always hit or miss as to how our experience is. Tonight we checked in and were told 20 minutes. We wait more than 40 as we watched tables after tables of people that arrived after us be seated. Our server Karen greeted us quickly, and took our drink orders as we looked at the menu. Once drinks were served, we ordered our food. We were a party of 5 and ordered burgers, fries, a cup of soup and a salmon dish that all took more than 45 minutes to arrive. The food was good and even the fries tasted fresh and hot (not always the case).  This restaurant is not high on our list to return to. When you start the experience off with others being seated before you and double the wait time and wait an extraordinarily long amount of time for this type of food, it makes for a lackluster experience that doesn't make you feel happy about your dinner.

This is a newer location in an commercial area of town that's being built up.  Everything was very clean and modern looking.  The Red Robin menu has a wide variety of food choices and never disappoints.  If you love fries, you already probably like Red Robin :) We came on a busy day and it still felt like the staff took time to chat with us and Eric impressed us with his memory skills by taking our orders by memory alone and those at other tables and getting everything right, even with complex orders.   The food was served hot and was absolutely delicious.  The hand spun milkshakes were tasty but not a strong flavor which was only slightly disappointing.  It's a noisy sports bar environment but a great spot with a good menu and tasty food.  Prices are okay but a tiny bit more than I'd prefer.

Good deals on burgers. However, the service continues to be consistently terrible. Went to tonight and got the "oh that's my bad" waiter who forgot everything and didn't pay attention. Why the F are we tipping you again? Had to remind on refills three or more times and he never checked in unless we called out as he walked past. It wasn't just our table too...his other table behind us walked out on him. Felt like wasted time and should have spent my $80 elsewhere.

I've been wanting to try Red Robin for a while, and finally talked my husband in to it on our way home from Orlando. Honestly, the only reason this is two stars and not one is because of the servers we had, and the dessert. Our server was super sweet, pretty prompt for the most part. She didn't ask us if we wants more fries (which is one of their selling points) other than that she was good.  My tween son got a bacon cheeseburger, my husband got some bbq burger--sorry I don't remember the name, and I got the guacamole burger. I couldn't taste the guacamole l, so I had to ask for a side of it. My husband said he really couldn't taste the bbq either. Burger flavor was ok.  My son got the Oreo milkshake, and enjoyed it. Kinda 'soupy' but everywhere is different. Hubs and I shared the mud pie and it was really good!  I think what bothered me the most about this trip was 3 tables around us sent food back. Something wasn't right in the kitchen tonight.
